author: Andy Chalk
description: Fair enough, but "fun" doesn't pay to keep the servers online.
title: 'Steam Charts don't measure fun,' Splitgate: Arena Reloaded studio says in response to worries about declining player numbers: 'They don't show the full picture'

author: Andy Chalk
description: Life is good.
title: Schedule 1 developer TVGS is 'an actual game studio' now, with an office, desks, and a new guy named Rob: 'By the end of the year, there will likely be 4 people working on Schedule 1'

author: Morgan Park
description: Embark and Arrowhead have found a multiplayer pricing sweet spot.
title: Embark boss says Arc Raiders $40 price was inspired by the likes of Helldivers 2: 'We'd rather make people feel like it's totally worth 40 bucks'

author: Christopher Livingston
description: With an assist from the Steam Winter sale.
title: Fallout Season 2 has doubled the number of people playing the Fallout games on Steam

author: Lincoln Carpenter
description: Practice makes perfect.
title: After 200 hours of intensive worm punching, Rubicon Karate master melees Armored Core 6's Ice Worm to death without taking damage

author: Andy Chalk
description: Matt Duffer's been playing Baldur's Gate 3 lately, and apparently it gave him an idea.
title: 'That's pretty cool': Larian boss Swen Vincke responds after Stranger Things co-creator credits Baldur's Gate 3 for inspiring the show's climactic battle

author: Andrea Shearon
description: Road-side Shawarma codes for another chance to get the order right.
title: All Road-side Shawarma codes in January 2026 for free revives

author: Jess Kinghorn
description: Finally, some good news.
title: Phison's E37T controller could make PCIe 5.0 SSDs faster, cooler and *get this* slightly less pricey

author: James Bentley
description: Would you strap an AI machine and a few cameras to your face?
title: Due to 'extremely limited inventory', Meta's smart glasses with a display won't be shipping outside the US anytime soon

author: Jacob Ridley
description: Be Quiet! has its eyes on the prize.
title: Be Quiet! keeps the 'consumer' in CES with new PC components including a dashing new Dark Rock 6 cooler

author: Nick Evanson
description: Because we all want a GPU that looks like a 1980s beatbox.
title: You probably won't be able to afford it but Gigabyte's new Aorus RTX 5090 Infinity card is so damn ugly, you'll be demanding payment just to tarnish your rig with one

author: Nick Evanson
description: The minimum system requirement is basic but the recommended hardware is fairly high-end, despite only promising 60 fps at 1080p.
title: 007 First Light reveals some pretty forgiving PC system requirements, with a couple caveats

author: Joshua Wolens
description: None of my accomplishments mean anything.
title: I give up: They're doing no-hit Souls trilogy runs with a saxophone now

author: Rory Norris
description: If you want Calcium, you'll need to move home first.
title: How to get Calcium Ore in StarRupture

author: Jeremy Laird
description: But the pricing will no doubt be distinctly 2026.
title: These new dual-slot Nvidia RTX graphics cards from PNY are a throwback to a simpler time of sensibly-sized GPUs

author: Jacob Fox
description: Most powerful, so presumably most expensive, too?
title: MSI announces the 'most powerful gaming laptop on the planet' in the form of the 300 W RTX 5090 Raider 16 Max HX

author: Robin Valentine
description: One last look back at the Christmas break.
title: What games did you play over the holidays?

author: James Bentley
description: More repairable laptops can only be a good thing.
title: This Panther Lake-led 'semi-modular' laptop is taking a page from Framework's very upgradable book and I'm all for it

author: Nick Evanson
description: Shame the hardware inside is a bit limited for gaming.
title: HP's new AI PC might look like a laptop that lost a fight with an angle grinder but it's compact and discreet as you could possibly get

author: Jacob Fox
description: Also, the glass is half full.
title: AMD and Nvidia talking up local AI for consumers could be bad news for those ChatGPT subscriptions but good news for us PC gamers

author: Rory Norris
description: Don't trek on with an empty stomach.
title: Best ways to get food in StarRupture

author: Rory Norris
description: You can't make a sprawling space factory if you're a dehydrated.
title: Best ways to get water in StarRupture

author: Jess Kinghorn
description: But is less more?
title: Gigabyte loudly and proudly says it's 'AI Forward' at CES 2026

author: Joshua Wolens
description: Mudang: Two Hearts might need a defib.
title: The Splinter Cell-ish game where you're a North Korean soldier guarding a K-Pop star has gone dark: Its YouTube channel is silent and we haven't seen the director since September

author: Harvey Randall
description: A good omen for 2026, if I've ever seen one.
title: Hacker, dressed as the pink Power Ranger, takes down 3 white supremacist sites live on stage after scraping details with AI: 'Maybe try mastering to host WordPress before world domination'

author: Jeremy Laird
description: Okay, this is officially confusing.
title: Asus launches new gaming monitors with two completely different 'RGB stripe' OLED panel technologies

author: Elie Gould
description: Third best seller? In the Year of our Lord 2025?
title: 'Not bad for a dead game': Palworld managed to get four nominations in Steam's Best of 2025 Awards, including 2nd place for most played game

author: Jacob Fox
description: Small and mighty.
title: Corsair brings Hall effect to its dinky enthusiast gaming keyboard in the form of the MAKR Pro 75

author: Jacob Fox
description: But maybe they shouldn't be called the same name as the original.
title: Corsair just announced carbon fiber and magnesium alloy versions of my favourite gaming mouse since Logitech's G Pro X Superlight

author: Jess Kinghorn
description: A-I don't know about this.
title: Project Ava is a desktop AI assistant that promises to watch your every move to offer both gaming advice and 'wardrobe tips'

author: James Bentley
description: Too cool for glasses?
title: Razer announces Project Motoko: kind of like AI glasses but a gaming headset

author: James Bentley
description: The "If it ain't broke, don't fix it" approach.
title: 'We built a breathable performance engine': Razer announces Iskur V2 gaming chair follow-up that seems a lot like the previous one

author: Nick Evanson
description: It'd be kinda nice to see some Snapdragon X2 Elite laptops first, though.
title: Qualcomm unveils the Snapdragon X2 Plus, with up to 35% more single-core CPU performance and 29% faster GPUs than X Plus chips

author: James Bentley
description: Over 16 million colours and I'll still pick some sort of red.
title: CyberPower PC unveils 'elegant' new case with three dedicated knobs on the side purely to adjust colours and I think I'm a bit smitten

author: Dave James
description: "You might hear our Smart Brick roaring like a jet plane or flushing like a toilet."
title: Lego's smart new 2x4 Smart Brick packs a custom ASIC, speaker, and synthesiser created by 'an expert team from the worlds of video gaming, computing... and more'

author: Elie Gould
description: Away with the pocket nukes.
title: Arc Raiders is looking to nerf the Trigger Nade among other items, but we're not sure whether it'll only be weaker against players, not Arcs

author: Harvey Randall
description: It was a wild wizard west out there.
title: Arrowhead CCO Johan Pilestedt corrects player who thought he'd griped about Magicka being review bombed, says 'we got so-so reviews' in 2011 because of bugs—also, it was 'released without our knowledge'

author: Kara Phillips
description: All that's missing is a catchy theme tune.
title: Someone has done the unthinkable and essentially turned Red Dead Redemption 2 into Katamari Damacy, but you can't argue with their reasoning: 'Because why not'

author: Kara Phillips
description: All active Anime fighting Simulator: Endless codes for Chikara and Yen.
title: All Anime Fighting Simulator: Endless codes for January 2026: Chikara and Yen

author: Jess Kinghorn
description: Happy New Year, indeed.
title: The Asus ROG Zephyrus G16 redesign is spoiling for a rematch against the Razer Blade 16, featuring a beefy RTX 5090 and improved cooling

author: Jacob Ridley
description: I'm debating how long it'd take for the novelty to wear off.
title: The latest ROG Zephyrus gaming laptop sports two screens and a unique way to play local co-op

author: Jacob Fox
description: "With Pulsar, you get the motion clarity of a theoretical 1,000 Hz monitor as if you're rendering at 1,000 fps."
title: Nvidia looks to further eradicate motion blur with new G-Sync Pulsar improvements for '4x the effective motion clarity'

author: Dave James
description: "A bit of a shift from a year ago where we were all about the AI PC."
title: Dell's CES 2026 chat was the most pleasingly un-AI briefing I've had in maybe 5 years

author: Andy Edser
description: Speedy hardware is a nice thing to have, but driver support can make and break a gaming experience.
title: Intel says its graphics drivers are now 'light years ahead of where we were a few years ago', and they'll need to be if it's going to tempt gamers towards its new iGPUs

author: Andy Edser
description: Strap in, it's about to get technical.
title: Intel's new top-end Core Ultra Series 3 mobile chips promise up to 77% faster iGPU gaming performance than Lunar Lake, and come with a whole host of friends

author: Dave James
description: It's convinced the 2nd gen Transformer model is good enough that you will.
title: Nvidia's promising '4K 240 Hz path traced gaming' with DLSS 4.5 but do you want 6x Multi Frame Gen?

author: Nick Evanson
description: And AMD tells us to only expect 2 - 3% higher performance on average, 5% at best if a game really likes higher clocks.
title: AMD launches its fastest gaming CPU yet, though the new Ryzen 7 9850X3D is clocked just 8% higher than the 9800X3D

author: Nick Evanson
description: It's certainly better for gaming than the 'new' Ryzen AI 400 chips, that's for sure.
title: The AMD Ryzen AI Max range gets two more entries, one of which looks perfect for the ultimate in handheld PC gaming
